clinical_study.brief_title: Genetic Factors and Immunological Determinism of Persistent Consequences of Chikungunya
clinical_study.official_title: Genetic Factors and Immunological Determinism of Persistent Consequences of Chikungunya Fever: Genome-wide Association Study

lead_sponsor.agency: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de la Réunion

collaborator.agency: Conservatoire national des Arts et Métiers

clinical_study.source: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de la Réunion

primary_outcome.measure: identify by a genome-wide association study the genetic factors associated with the evolutionary profile of Chikungunya
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: to determine if certain genetic profiles may be predictive of progression to asymptomatic or acute disease, or to the chronic character of the manifestations of the disease

intervention.description: Administration of scales: SF-12v2, EQ-5D, QCD, DN4, EIMIR, MFIS-5 et EHAD
Collection of 20 ml of saliva with a kit of saliva collection
Collection of 20 ml of blood with kit of blood collection

biospec_descr.textblock: Saliva and blood collection for genetical analysis (GWAS)

study_pop.textblock: Subject with a serological status known for Chikungunya virus for the period between March 1st, 2005 and December 31st, 2006 (epidemic period in reunion Island).
